Expectation1: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation1: A critical bearing is screeching loudly and threatening an immediate breakdown.
Expectation2: Show love and kindness to others, following the teachings of Jesus
Situation2: They notice someone in their circle going through difficulties and respond with care
Story:
The shrill screech of the bearing echoed through the workshop, drowning out every other thought. I knew if I didn’t act fast, the whole line could grind to a halt, costing the company thousands and putting everyone behind schedule. My supervisor’s words from this morning rang in my ears: “We can’t afford any downtime today. Stay sharp.” I grabbed my tools, heart pounding, already mapping out the steps in my head—shut down, isolate, replace, test. 

But as I hurried past the break room, I caught sight of Mark slumped at a table, head in his hands. He’d been quiet all week, and I remembered the prayer request he’d shared at church—his wife’s illness, the mounting bills. My faith tells me to be present, to show compassion, to sit with those who are hurting. I felt the weight of Jesus’ words: “Love one another as I have loved you.” 

I stood frozen, torn between the urgent call of the machine and the silent plea of a friend in pain. My hands trembled, caught between the wrench and the open door, as I wrestled with what I was truly meant to do.
